sen.j: 前田 則邦（まえだ のりくに、弘化4年（1847年） - 大正4年（1915年））は、政治家、画家。
sen.e: Norikuni MAEDA (1847 - 1915) was a painter and a statesman.
Norikuni MAEDA (1847 - 1915) was a painter and a statesman.
Norikuni MAEDA (1847 - 1915) was a painter and a statesman.

sen.j: 富山藩9代藩主前田利幹の次男前田利民の子。
sen.e: He was a son of Toshitami MAEDA, who was the second son of Toshitsuyo MAEDA, the ninth lord of Toyama Domain.
He was a son of Toshitami MAEDA, who was the second son of Toshitsuyo MAEDA, the ninth lord of Toyama Domain.
He was a son of Toshitami MAEDA, who was the second son of Toshitsuyo MAEDA, the ninth lord of Toyama Domain.
His childhood name was Taketaro.
His childhood name was Taketaro.
His childhood name was Taketaro.
He was also known as Tamikuni and Harue.
He was also known as Tamikuni and Harue.
He was also known as Tamikuni and Harue.

sen.j: 初代富山市長（明治22年（1889年）6月2日～明治28年（1895年）5月27日）となる。
sen.e: He was elected as the first mayor of Toyama City for the term, June 2, 1889 - May 27, 1895.
He was elected as the first mayor of Toyama City for the term, June 2, 1889 - May 27, 1895.
He was elected as the first mayor of Toyama City for the term, June 2, 1889 - May 27, 1895.

sen.j: 嘉永7年（1854年）知行500石と若土姓を賜り、臣下となる。
sen.e: He was awarded 500-koku enfeoffment and a family name, WAKATSUCHI, and became a retainer in 1854.
He was awarded 500-koku enfeoffment and a family name, WAKATSUCHI, and became a retainer in 1854.
He was awarded 500-koku enfeoffment and a family name, WAKATSUCHI, and became a retainer in 1854.

sen.j: 明治8年に前田姓に復した。
sen.e: He reclaimed his former family name, MAEDA, in 1875.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He reclaimed his former family name, MAEDA, in 1875.
He reclaimed his former family name, MAEDA, in 1875.

sen.j: その後、富山師範学校校長、婦負・上新川・中新川の郡長、明治11年（1878年）に設立した十二銀行（北陸銀行の前身）頭取などを歴任した。
sen.e: Since then, he successively worked in different positions: a head of Toyama Normal School, head of Nei, Kaminiikawa, and Nakaniikawa Districts, president of Juni Bank (the predecessor of Hokuriku Bank), which was established in 1878.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since then, he successively worked in different positions: a head of Toyama Normal School, head of Nei, Kaminiikawa, and Nakaniikawa Districts, president of Juni Bank (the predecessor of Hokuriku Bank), which was established in 1878.

Since then, he successively worked in different positions: a head of Toyama Normal School, head of Nei, Kaminiikawa, and Nakaniikawa Districts, president of Juni Bank (the predecessor of Hokuriku Bank), which was established in 1878.

sen.j: 画家としても山水画を残している。
sen.e: He was also known as an artist and left his sansui-ga work.
He was also known as an artist and left his sansui-ga work.
He was also known as an artist and left his sansui-ga work.
